roleset.name: be subsequent, temporally or spatially, or less than
roleset.note: TRAIL-V NOTES: Comparison to 'follow'. Member of Vncls chase-51.6. (from trail.01-v)

example.name: be less than
example.text: Hit by higher costs and lower sales, Caterpillar Inc. said third-quarter earnings tumbled 43% and full-year earnings will trail last year's results.

example.name: spatial
example.text: John trailed the ferocious bunny rabbit through the woods.

example.name: redundant locative
example.text: In the very front rank , [two men]-1 were wounded and staggered along , [*-1]trailing blood behind them .

example.name: stationary trailing
example.text: His rock was to the right of a V-shaped inlet , a big , brown , lumpy rock trailing seaweed whiskers .

example.name: inverted syntax
example.text: He had taken a carbine down from the wall and it trailed from his hand , the stock bumping on the wood floor .
example.arg: the stock bumping on the wood floor

roleset.name: trail off: come to an end

example.name: a sticky end
example.text: Commodore has said it expects sales to rebound, but market researchers have said that sales of the low-end products may finally be trailing off.
